title: Job Vacancies at TAIDOB College
content:
TAIDOB College is a government approved private secondary school strategically located within Goshen Estate, Asero, Abeokuta, Ogun State. Dr. Abayomi Oluwatosin Jiboku, a seasoned educationist cum administrator established the college in October 1994 as a model with the motive of providing educational services to all races irrespective of gender, religion, tribe or social status. This unique citadel of learning is situated in a quiet, serene and conducive environment, equipped with modern educational infrastructural facilities and of dedicated and experienced tutors.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Chemistry Tutor
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Teaching specialized subject(s) to students in designated classes.
	Attending to all assigned classes regularly and punctually.
	Conducting class tests, periodic tests, practical/projects, homework etc on a regular basis and marking all exercise books while proper records obtained by students are kept as continuous assessments.
	Endorsement of Students' Notes & Assessments
	Involvement in the conduct of afternoon session classes for students at designated times on the timetable.


Requirements


	Must possess at least B.Sc., B.Ed., B.tech, HND, M.Sc. or M.Ed. in Chemistry or other related fields from reputable institutions.
	Must possess at least 2 years of cognate experience teaching specialized subjects.
	At least 2 years of work experience as a Chemistry tutor
	Meticulous attention to detail with superb organizational skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 per month. 

Application Closing Date: 31st December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tcrecruitment10@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Economics Tutor

Job Location: Abeokuta, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Teaching specialized subject(s) to students in designated classes.
	Attending to all assigned classes regularly and punctually.
	Conducting class tests, periodic tests, practical/projects, homework etc on a regular basis and marking all exercise books while proper records obtained by students are kept as continuous assessments.
	Involvement in the conduct of afternoon session classes for students at designated times on the timetable.


Requirements


	Must possess at least B.Sc., B.Ed., HND, in Economics or other related fields from reputable institutions.
	Must possess at least 2 years of cognate experience teaching Economics in a secondary school.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience working as a Economics Tutor
	Meticulous attention to detail with superb organizational skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 per month.

Application Closing Date: 31st December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tcrecruitment10@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.)  Agricultural Science Tutor

Job Location: Abeokuta, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Teaching specialized subject(s) to students in designated classes.
	Attending to all assigned classes regularly and punctually.
	Conducting class tests, periodic tests, practical/projects, homework, etc on a regular basis and marking all exercise books while proper records are obtained by students are kept as continuous assessments.
	Involvement in the conduct of afternoon session classes for students at designated times on the timetable.


Requirements


	Must possess at least a B.Sc., B.Ed., B.Agric, in Agricultural Science or other related fields from reputable institutions.
	Must possess at least 2 years of cognate experience teaching Agric Science in a secondary school.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience working as an Agric Tutor
	Meticulous attention to detail with superb organizational skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Salary
N110,000 - N115,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 14th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tcrecruitment10@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Dangote Group is one of Nigeria&rsquo;s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard &ndash; earned reputation for excellent business practices and products&rsquo; quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Network Operations Specialist

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	The Network Operations Specialist is responsible for the daily performance and availability of the organisation&rsquo;s Local and Wide Area Networks (LAN &amp; WAN).
	Analyse the network and recommend upgrades/changes; assess the organisation&#39;s current and future network needs.


Responsibilities


	Plan and maintain network installation, circuit integration, network equipment maintenance, and operations.
	Configure, monitor, and troubleshoot network issues.
	Monitoring network performance to identify potential problems and help ensure high-performance levels.
	Prepare a monthly network availability report.
	Maintaining the network infrastructure by troubleshooting problems with the Firewall, routers, switches, wireless controller, firewall, wireless access-point, radius server, etc.
	Create BOM for new, faulty and EOL network devices.
	Implement software upgrades or patches on network-related devices.
	Maintaining records of network activity, such as logs of user activity or system performance metrics
	Facilitate Change Management requests and execution according to SOP or MOP.
	Ensure network documentation is up to date.


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s degree (B.Sc.) or Higher National Diploma (HND) in computer science, information technology, computer engineering, or a related field.&nbsp;&nbsp;
	Minimum 3 - 6 years of working experience in the same or related position.
	Cisco and Networking certifications; CCNP, Fortinet NSE4 &amp; Palo-Alto PCNSE
	Experience working with networking protocols, including TCP/IP, IPsec, DMVPN, GRE, VXLAN, VRRP, MPLS, BGP, OSPF, and EIGRP.
	Proficient in leading networking technologies, software-defined WAN (SD-WAN), Wi-Fi 7, and network automation.
	Proficient in Unified Threat Management (UTM) Solutions.
	Excellent communication skills.

Network Operations Specialist Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Network Operations Specialist

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Network Operations Specialist is responsible for the daily performance and availability of the organisation’s Local and Wide Area Networks (LAN & WAN).
	Analyse the network and recommend upgrades/changes; assess the organisation's current and future network needs.


Responsibilities


	Plan and maintain network installation, circuit integration, network equipment maintenance, and operations.
	Configure, monitor, and troubleshoot network issues.
	Monitoring network performance to identify potential problems and help ensure high-performance levels.
	Prepare a monthly network availability report.
	Maintaining the network infrastructure by troubleshooting problems with the Firewall, routers, switches, wireless controller, firewall, wireless access-point, radius server, etc.
	Create BOM for new, faulty and EOL network devices.
	Implement software upgrades or patches on network-related devices.
	Maintaining records of network activity, such as logs of user activity or system performance metrics
	Facilitate Change Management requests and execution according to SOP or MOP.
	Ensure network documentation is up to date.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree (B.Sc.) or Higher National Diploma (HND) in computer science, information technology, computer engineering, or a related field.  
	Minimum 3 - 6 years of working experience in the same or related position.
	Cisco and Networking certifications; CCNP, Fortinet NSE4 & Palo-Alto PCNSE
	Experience working with networking protocols, including TCP/IP, IPsec, DMVPN, GRE, VXLAN, VRRP, MPLS, BGP, OSPF, and EIGRP.
	Proficient in leading networking technologies, software-defined WAN (SD-WAN), Wi-Fi 7, and network automation.
	Proficient in Unified Threat Management (UTM) Solutions.
	Excellent communication skills.

Front Desk Officer Job at Echo-Scan Services Limited




        
    

        
        Echo-Scan Services Limited to ensure global best practice delivery of diagnostic services in Nigeriaproviding wide range of diagnostic services, including pathology and molecular diagnostics, genetics testing and radiology to patients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities

	Coordination and management of reception and waiting areas to ensure a suitable environment and ambience. Client
	registration – collect and input all necessary and accurate data from the client
	Accept the client’s mode of payment in line with company policy, collect and register the client’s payment.
	Maintain patient accounts by obtaining, recording, and updating personal and financial information.
	Politely guide the client in the direction of the procedure/examination paid for.
	Ensure proper filing and archiving of patient record in expected format.
	Ensure usage of checklist/job order and proper check-out.
	Refer client to feedback channels and compel compliance.
	Anticipate guest needs and build rapport with customers.
	Protects patients' rights by maintaining confidentiality of personal and financial information.
	Address customer complaints and escalate to Branch operations Manager / Customer Experience Manager
	Ensure compliance with SOP, safety, health, and quality standard.
	Maintain registration flow by accurately and efficiently moving patients through the process.
	Interact with patients by answering questions, providing information, and keeping the reception area in order.
	Maintain general filing system and files appropriate correspondence electronically or manually.
	Responsible for report generation and dispatch in support of departmental goals and objectives.
	Ensure accurate product knowledge to guide and provide relevant and timely information to clients.
	Timely processing orders, forms, applications, and requests.
	Taking part in training and other learning opportunities to expand knowledge of company and position
	Perform FDO duties for other branches by proxy when need arises.
	Performs other general administrative tasks as directed by line manager.


Job Requirements


	B.Sc. in Health Management, Basic Sciences or any relevant course
	Experience in Diagnostics Industry
	Excellent communication skills
	Use of computer and Microsoft office
	Attention to detail and skill in proper patient identification.
	Time management
	Ability to connect with several types of patients.
	Consistently completes duties neatly, accurately in a timely manner.


Method of Application
